sect2.title: Basic Configuration
sect2.para: The /etc/systemd/system.conf file contains a set of options to control basic systemd operations. The default file has all entries commented out with the default settings indicated. This file is where the log level may be changed as well as some basic logging settings. See systemd-system.conf(5) manual page for details on each configuration option.

The system location for the configuration files is /usr/lib/tmpfiles.d/*.conf. The local configuration files are in /etc/tmpfiles.d. Files in /etc/tmpfiles.d override files with the same name in /usr/lib/tmpfiles.d. See tmpfiles.d(5) manual page for file format details.

sect2.title: Overriding Default Services Behavior
sect2.para: A systemd service contents can be overriden by creating a directory and a configuration file in /etc/systemd/system. For example:

screen.userinput:
mkdir -pv /etc/systemd/system/foobar.service.d
cat > /etc/systemd/system/foobar.service.d/foobar.conf << EOF [Service] Restart=always RestartSec=30 EOF

sect2.para: See systemd.unit(5) manual page for more information. After creating the configuration file, run systemctl daemon-reload and systemctl restart foobar to activate the changes to a service.
